intro: Willughbya pauciflora, commonly known as the Christmas pine, is a unique plant native to the tropical rainforests of northern Queensland, Australia. It is a member of the Araucariaceae family, which includes other ancient coniferous species. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, cone-like structure that resembles a pine cone, though it is not a true conifer. Willughbya pauciflora produces small, inconspicuous flowers and is adapted to grow in nutrient-poor soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for studying the evolution of gymnosperms in the region.
